009package GenericFilterDemos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
017import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.Kernel1D;
018import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.Kernel2D;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
020import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
021import imagingbook.core.plugin.JavaDocHelp;
022
023
024/**
025 * This ImageJ plugin shows how to construct a generic linear filter
026 * based on classes {@link LinearFilter} and {@link Kernel2D}.
027 * This plugin works for all types of images.
028 * On RGB color images, the filter is applied independently
029 * to the three color channels.
030 * The active image is modified.
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/03/30
034 * 
035 * @see LinearFilter
036 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
037 * @see GenericFilter
038 * @see Kernel2D
039 * @see GaussianKernel1D
040 */
041public class Gaussian_Filter_Separable implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
042        
043        static double SIGMA = 7.5;
044
045    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
046        return DOES_ALL;
047    }
048
049    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
050        IJ.log("sigma = " + SIGMA);
051                Kernel1D kernel = new GaussianKernel1D(SIGMA);
052                GenericFilter filter = new LinearFilterSeparable(kernel);
053                filter.applyTo(ip);
054    }
055
056}
